Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping
Description: An event card designed for people who wanted to help defray the cost of shipping for the Kickstarter.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping & Handling
Description: Similar to the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping card, this event card was designed for international backers that wanted to help defray the costs of shipping and handling. Has a different effect than the Shipping card.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Norah Wells
Description: A Kickstarter-exclusive expansion card contained in the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Collector's Edition and also offered as an add-on.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Evolution Island
Description:
The Island rose from the sea, growing quickly. Its high mountains, dense forests, vast plains and burning deserts attracted animals: insects, amphibians, birds and mammals. Will one island be able to sustain it all?

Evolution Island is a tile managing and card drafting board game for 1 player aged 12 and up, that can be played in 20 to 30 minutes.

Player will use drafted cards to place and move tiles in course of 15 turns in order to help evolution rise one dominant animal species and one dominant land type on the island, all the time trying to preserve ecosystem by avoiding extinction of remaining species or disappearance of some land types.

—description from the designer

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Aliens of the Imperium
Description: Aliens of the Imperium adds 19 new Captain's Cards and 1 new Adventure Card, expanding on some of the alien races inhabiting the empire.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Supplemental Deck
Description: A 60-card deck that contains new cards as well as additional cards from the ship decks that come only in a single copy.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Supplemental Deck Collector's Edition
Description: A 90-card deck that contains new cards as well as additional cards from the ship decks that come only in a single copy.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Don McKinney
Description: An event card that is a memorial for Don McKinney.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Hunter Gordon
Description: An event card that is a memorial for Hunter Gordon.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: La Isla del Tesoro
Description:
The pirates has arrived at Treasure Island and Kico the parrot will help them to take the loot.

Every turn, move the parrot in a straight line placing him on a doubloon that has the same number of spaces you moved, using the squares which has doubloons and ignoring the empty ones. Keep that doubloon.

When there is no place to move, the player with the most doubloons is the winner of the game.

Name: Storisende
Description:
Storisende intricately merges the two most prominent goals in the realm of abstract strategy games, elimination and territory. It does so with uniform material and a simple unified behaviour. This unique characteristic wasn't intended and not wholly foreseen, but it emerged during play.

Players alternately move pieces. A piece can be a single man or a mono-colored stack and moves as far as it is high in a straight line in one of the six main directions. Pieces may merge or split and they capture opponent's pieces by replacement, regardless of size, removing the opponent's piece.

The actions of both players inherently lead to a division of the board in a number of territories, separated by a contiguous Wall. Play takes place down in the territories as well as up on the Wall. The fight on the Wall is existential: it's all about eliminating the opponent. But whoever dominates it has the means to claim territories of take them from the opponent afterwards.

Moving is not compulsory and the game ends when both players pass on successive turns. The winner is then the player with the most territory, counted as cells of the board. Draws are possible but not frequent.

-description from designer

Name: Asanakids
Description:
The princess feels bad. She has decided to meditate but the bad emotions can block her chakras. However if the chakras are aligned in time, the good emotions will flow sweeping away the bad ones. So, do yoga poses! align the chakras! Practice mindfulness to teach the princess how to feel better before it is soo late!

Asanakids is a fun board game to initiate the practice of yoga and mindfullness to kids. It is a family game that can be played until 6 players (o even more) from the age of 4 but it can be played alone too.

It is a cooperative game where the players must help the princess too feel better. To achieve this the players will have to do yoga poses (called asanas) and express their feelings. It is a beautiful game with watercolour pictures and mandalas, that nothing has to do with religion and metaphysical believes.

The game has four key aspects:

Fun: First and foremost, Asanakids is a game, so fun and light-hearted time with friends and familly is the main purpose.

Fitness: Doing the yoga poses the players will excercise the body. Don't worry, the poses are thought for begginers. Also see the companion trying to stay in balance on one feet in 'tree pose' can be very fun too, doesn't it?

Memory: A part of the game mechanic requieres to remember the tokens position, so the players stimulate the memory and concentration.

Emotional Inteligence: Another important par of the game is learning to recognise the emotions and express them. Also the players will improve their empathy seeing what the others feel.

—description from the designer

Name: Beasts of Balance: Hotbelly the Hangry Dragon
Description:
Legend tells of a cranky, cantankerous and generously proportioned dragon with a terrible temper and a ridiculous name… Play this high scoring Legendary Beast in Co-op mode to unlock a host of weird and wonderful new hybrid Beasts including Gnarlyscar and Hungry Hungry Flamechomp. Add Hotbelly in Battles mode to summon this riled-up reptile from the volcano and watch it burp fireballs at your opponents’ Beasts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beasts of Balance: Fancyprance the Fabulous Unicorn
Description:
Cantering in, surrounded by disco glitter and all things sparkly, is Fancyprance. Stack Fancyprance in the tower to summon this rainbow-pooping popinjay into your world. Add this mane attraction in Co-op mode mode to unlock a host of weird and wonderful new hybrid Beasts including Squigglehorn and Heavenly Hoghoof. Play in Battles mode once all your elements have been stacked and use Fancyprance’s powerful rainbow poop to boost your region’s score.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beasts of Balance: Moby Brick the Space Whale
Description:
High above the world, the beautiful, bubbery Moby Brick plummets through the cosmos… Stack Moby Brick in the tower to summon this celestial cetacean. Add this high scoring Legendary in Co-op mode mode to unlock a host of weird and wonderful new hybrid Beasts including Cosmic Shuttlefish and Bazooka Beluga. Pick the perfect elements to play to summon Moby Brick in Battles mode, then use your smart device or TV remote to guide the Space Whale down to earth to squish your opponents’ Beasts; but be careful not to splat your own!

—description from the publisher

Name: Beasts of Balance: Paranormal Pieces
Description:
Add some spectral surprises and stranger things to your world with these spooky artefacts. Curses and crosses and crabs – oh my! Add more strategy to both Co-op and Battles mode. Expand your bestiary with Beasts alive and undead.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battlefields: From Broadswords to Bullets
Description:
The purpose of this book is to provide a simple set of fast moving rules, to simulate battles using model soldiers in the “HO” scale.  This Scale is also referred to as 1/72nd or 20mm, and these figures are the most commonly available (and cheapest) on the market today.  As such, it should be easy for the tactically inclined gamer to find armies of whatever time or country he or she may be drawn to.

These rules favor simplicity over “realism” and provide a fast moving and exciting style of play. They give you the feel of a historical battle ... without the death and tragedy of the real thing.

With this game, you can test your knowledge and understanding of strategy and tactics, while you enjoy the company of like-minded friends.  You can reenact actual historic battles or create your own unique scenarios.  The game is quite open-ended and has a lot of possibility for surprise, intrigue, fun and (hopefully) victory.

—description from rulebook

Name: Catch!
Description:
Catch! is a co-operative childrens game of cat-and-mouse.

A mischievous little mouse has stolen the cats’  bowl of treats and is making a run for the fence. If he can make it through the garden and to the fence before the cats surround him, he’ ll get to keep the treats all for himself. Can you help the cats surround the scuttling little mouse before he gets away? If you can, you all win!

—description from the designer

Name: Table Top Baseball
Description:
Table Top Baseball is played on a large (20"x30") rubber play mat. The playing pieces are chips of various sizes and colors.

The pitcher slides the ball "puck" from the pitchers mound towards the batters box. Results depend on where the puck lands.

The batter slides the puck from the batters box towards the field. Results depend on where the puck lands.

It comes rolled up in a tube.

Name: IRS
Description:
An exciting new game of skill and chance in which you attempt to outsmart the ever present tax collector.
—description from the rulebook

A Yahtzee-style game played with 5 dice, 4 regular d6 and 1 with "IRS" replacing the 1 pip. Like Yahtzee, the scorecard is divided into upper and lower sections. The upper must be completed before anything in the lower can be done.

The upper section sets your Base Salary. You choose which number you are going for (1's through 6's) and roll all five dice. Count the ones that match what you are going for. You can continue rolling the 5 dice and adding more of your chosen number (1-6), thereby increasing your salary. One of the dice has "IRS" in the 1 position. If it ever comes up your turn is over and you only get half of the income you've accrued for that number.

The lower section lets you add extra income via Stock Options, Profit Sharing, Capital Gains, and a Tax Refund. Those rolls are also negatively effected if IRS come up.

Once you add your Base Salary and extra income you get your Total Income. You then have to roll for an Audit. Depending on your roll you will subtract money leaving you with your Take Home Pay. Highest Take Home Pay wins.

You record your scores on a pad of 1040 Forms.

Comes in a 2pc dice cup that doubles as case. The cap reads "Don't Gamble With Your Life".

—user summary

Name: Moonsun
Description:
Have you ever heard of a game that uses a unique card ? There it is ! A game with a tarot card with the moon on one face and the sun on the other. The trick is that depending on the side or the position of the card you have different powers.

In this game, you try to establish the balance between Day and Night by making 2 crosses of each color. Players take turns an on his turn, a player must follow these steps in order:

     Draw a card from the deck.
     Play a card horizontally or vertically on the side of your choice (Sun or Moon).
     Use one of the cards you have in front of you.
     Flip the card you have just used.


The first player who succeeds in making to monochromatic crosses wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Verge Of War
Description:
"Verge Of War" is a Sci-Fi wargame with 28mm resin miniatures set in the original VergeOfWar Universe.

The opening campaign is dedicated to the first clash of Human forces and Seit, the race of mighty psionics and insidious intriguers, at the edge of human-inhabited space. The forces of the Human fleet conducted a routine raid against pirates in the sector but discovered that they were not alone in the universe.

In total, there are 10 factions in the game – Human Empire, The Seit Civilization,
Pirates, The Asgar, The Kja Kingdoms, Eltofa, Rungars, Skrags, Triclons, Arachnids.
Each faction has its own history, political structure, physiological characteristics,
hierarchy.

Verge Of War is a classical wargame with RPG elements. The game uses
six-sided dice, D6. Before the battle begins, your commander chooses skills from
three sets that reflect different strategies, doctrines or military specialties. Each set
is divided into 10 levels, which reflect the experience and expertise of your
commander. A typical game consists of 6 game rounds and takes about 30-120
minutes depending on the size of the armies.

The game has flexible mechanics and balanced rules that are easy to learn.
Build your army, conquer the galaxy and make your commander hero famous all over the world! 
Achieve immortality!

THE FUTURE IS UNCERTAIN...YOU SHAPE IT!

Name: Art Pieces
Description:
In each round you will reveal 3 idea cards. Every person must draw an image including those 3 ideas (for example book+accident+zombie). 
After 90 seconds everyone stops and the drawings are shown. 
An award card is revealed. This card has a criteria to evaluate the drawings: most unique, misunderstood, simple, awesome, boring, etc.
Then the players choose which one did the best picture according to an award criteria and that player gets an award card.
The game ends when all awards are granted. The player with more awards wins.

As you can see it’s not important who draws better, but who meets the criteria in a better way.

It also has a variant in which you must reveal a commission card which adds an extra complexity (example: comic strip, put a title to your work, etc).

It also has a solitary mode.

—user summary

Name: Kampfgruppe Scherer: Player’s Guide
Description: Articles and additional scenarios for the Kampfgruppe Scherer ASL historical module. There is a 60 page player’s guide and seven scenario cards which consist of scenarios KGS16-23, SASL Mission KGS1, and scenario FT224.

Name: Destination Earth
Description:
Bzzrt....krttt...."This is a distress signal from the exploration starship Frontier...” ksht....“..e ship has been overrun by aliens... almost the entire crew are dead... we are the only ones le..” vzrttt... “We've set a course back to Earth and we'll try to fend the best we can but if anyone can help us... Please... we need help...!".. hssssssssssss....................

---

Destination Earth is a solo dice-rolling placement game in which you take control of the last two surviving crew members (from a choice of twelve) on an exploration Starship overrun by aliens.

On a turn you will use action points to move from room-to-room eliminate aliens and keeping them from destroying the crew members or overrunning the ship.

You must try to keep the crew members alive and the ship from being destroyed over a series of 'rounds' (indicated on a Journey Tracker).

If you do then you will reach Earth and the alien threat will be eradicated.

If you don't, the Frontier will be lost forever.

Can you keep the crew members alive to get the ship back to Earth so the aliens can be eradicated? Or will they succumb to the Alien menace? Only one way to find out.....

Name: Ridiculous Expositions
Description:
Ridiculous Expositions is the word game that seems innocent, sounds indecent and sure is good for tons of naughty laughs.

Two teams compete to discover the saucy expressions that lie beneath the surface phrases.   Watch friends sound out dirty phrases without even realizing it!  But that's not all - each round, there's a Swinger. This smooth lady or gent gets the chance to take one (or a few) for their team by stealing any unsolved cards from their opponents.  There's five rounds of enjoyment.  Whoever has the most points at the end wins the game. Ridiculous Expositions is perfect for lovers of crude humor with quick and dirty minds!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeons & Dragons: Rock Paper Wizard – Fistful of Monsters
Description:
Encounter all your favorite classic D&D creatures, such as mimics, umber hulks, and beholders, in Rock Paper Wizard – Fistful of Monsters.

In this expansion for Rock Paper Wizard, a new threat has entered the mix: the wandering monster. Each wandering monster has its own unique ability that's capable of forcing a wizard to move around the board, lose gold, or even take an injury token.

Wizards aren't totally defenseless, however. A stack of magical items, such as a Ring of Spell Storing and Wand of Fireballs, is located at the entrance to the cave. Use these in combination with spells to avoid the wandering monster and move into a scoring position while gaining the fewest injury tokens. If you don't, you're going to have the pay the cleric a sack of gold to heal you!

Fistful of Monsters has a deeper box than the base game, which is required for play, so that you can store everything in one box.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: World in Flames Collector's Edition Deluxe
Description:
It is the dawn of September 1939, and the dark clouds of war hover over the globe. China and Japan have already been at war for more than 2 years and now a Continental war is about to become a worldwide war, a World in Flames.

You, as leader of your nation, must guide your country through its darkest days, enhancing your economy, working with allies, building the units you need and then employing them effectively to defeat your manifold foes. You are in charge of your country from 1939 until 1945 or until you conquer or fall.

World in Flames shows the entire world and will be the world's biggest boardgame. That's right, for the first time ever all maps and displays will be hard-mounted boards with bound edges.

World in Flames can be played from 2 to 6 players (and can easily be played solitaire too). There are 20 campaigns you can play, from the hour long Victory in The West campaign to the 150 hour Global War mega campaign. World in Flames is the ultimate gaming challenge.

The World in Flames Collector’s Edition Deluxe game consists of:

        the World in Flames Collector’s Edition Classic game;
        Planes in Flames Collector's edition expansion;
        Ships in Flames Collector's edition expansion;
        Divisions in Flames Collector's edition expansion; and
        Territories in Flames Collector's edition expansion;


for a total of 5 hard-mounted maps. a hard-mounted turn record chart (including Production circle), hard-mounted task-force display, 4900 counters, 2 full-colour rule books and 5 colour charts.

Scope: Global Strategic 
Complexity: Scenarios - Moderate, Campaigns - High
Solitaire: Highly Suitable
Players: Up to 6
Ages: 12 to Adult

(from ADG)

Name: Unfair: Playtester Promo Card
Description:
Promo card.

     Available only as a gift, directly from Joel, as a personal thank you for contributing to improving the game.


Shuffle this card into the relevant deck(s) during setup and proceed as normal.
Add no more than one copy of any sneak peek or promo card.

Playtester (Staff Member)
At game end:
You may change one rule before scoring:

     1 point for each 1 coin, or
     No penalty for failed Blueprints, or
     20 points for each unused attraction space


The rules... may need a little work...

Name: ZnajZnak: Felismered?
Description:
ZnajZnak. Feliszmered? is an educational game designed for two players, who acquire knowledge automatically while playing. ZnajZnak allows even 32 persons to play with the use of one set of cards. While playing the ZnajZnak game, players learn to recognise symbolic characters, dates, figures, places and objects of the Polish history.

The game is composed of 132 cards. Each of them presents 12 different symbols concerning the contemporary history of Poland and Hungary. If you take a closer look at any two cards, you'll find out that they contain a common character. 132 cards, 133 symbols and always only one common character. The aim of a player is to notice the character on two other cards on the table and to tell its name as fast as possible. If the player succeeds to do that, he/she passes his/her card to another player. If he/she does not know the name of the character, he/she turns the card, reads the definition of the symbol, puts a new card on the table, and the game goes on. The winner is the person who first gets rid of all the cards in hand.

The fates of Poland and Hungary have been linked together for centuries. Examples may be found not only in the distant past, but also still so close to us, in the 20th century. Poles and Hungarians could also count on each other’s friendship and support in the face of threats from the greatest totalitarian regimes of all times – German Nazism and communism.
The stories of both nations are filled with symbols, so when preparing the game, we had to make a selection, limiting the timeframe mainly to the 20th century. This is how a set of 133 symbols shown on the cards of the game was created. We hope that it will give both nations a chance to take a closer look at each other’s stories. After all, the Polish-Hungarian celebrations of the sixtieth anniversary of the 1956 events, organized in 2016, were held under the slogan "Poles and Hungarians, we all remember together".

-description from designer

Name: La bataille des Alphamons
Description:
La bataille des Alphamons is a simple simultaneous action selection game for two to 6 players. This game was designed to teach the alphabetical order to young children.

Start by making an alignment with the small alphabet cards that are numbered 1 to 26. This will be used as a reference: letter a will be the smallest and the z will be the highest card.
Deal 9 cards to each player. They all have a card printed on it. All players choose a card, then reveal them simultaneously. Use the reference cards to check witch card is the highest. The highest card wins the trick and take all the cards.
After 9 rounds, the one who has the most cards wins the game.

Alternate rule for older children:
If all the players are familiar with the alphabetical order, you can play with the following rules:
Each time someone makes a trick, the player that has revealed the lowest card can swap 2 cards in the alphabet.
When you have played all the cards in your hand, take the cards you have won to continue playing.
The game ends when one of the player has no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Freaks: The Violet Morass
Description:
Ever since the oh-so-bureaucratic Magiss Empire purchased the rights to Space Freaks’ 35th season, viewers have noticed a number of… reforms. The irreplaceable Arena-Master has been… well… replaced. His head has been removed and we now find a Level 7 Functionary serving as Myron’s personal megaphone…

Level 7 Funticonary: “After careful observation of last year’s epic confrontations, I have re-aligned the confluence of strategic craft and command in battle, so that they may culminate in new, metaphysical experiences…”

Myron Musclehead: “YOU’VE re-aligned?  This show is mine!  ALL MINE!!”

With Space Freaks: The Violet Morass, discover two new arenas buried amongst the deadly thickets and perilous waters of the planet Azorax 5.

Mow down everything in your path as you claim new territory. Erect your corporate flag over a Neutral Base and score victory points each turn. Revel in the amazing combinations of new head- and body parts.  Create Freak upgrades in laboratories to propel your Freaks to the next lethal level. Outwit your opponents by integrating new equipment into your game tactics. Be on the lookout for any tricks up the new Arena Master’s sleeve.

Staying in Myron’s favor may even allow you to modify the laws of Space Freaks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sandwich Masters: Attack Pack!
Description:
10 cards to add to the game:

4 Health inspectors 
4 attack condiments 
2 new events

Name: Sweet Jenny
Description:
Sweet Jenny  is  a  gambling  game  played  in  the  world  of  Théah,  the  setting  of  the  7th  Sea  role­playing  game,  and  is  inspired  by  classic  card  games.  As  a  game  itself,  Sweet  Jenny  is  a  mix  of  poker,  blackjack  and  three­card  monte using it's own unique deck.  It  combines  strategy,  bluffing,  mind­games  and  blind  luck  to  create  a  chaotic  and  fun  diversion  for  sailors,  dock­hands  and  slumming  nobles  alike.

Each round, each  player antes up and is dealt a  single  card  facedown. The  dealer also lays  out  a  number  of  facedown cards into  the  middle  of  the  play  area.   Over three phases, players secretly spy their own or middle cards, swap out cards, or discard their cards, in the attempt to manipulate the splay of cards. To win the round, a player must end up with the highest hand without going over 17.

The winner of the hand wins the antes. The holder of the most ante coins when another player has none left wins the game. The game gets more complex with unique role cards that give players more powers to manipulate cards and the board.

-description from designer

Name: Mythic Battles: Ragnarök – Ymir
Description:
Ymir Rises!
First born in the Nine Worlds long before the gods, Ymir is the ancestor of the Giants. 
His brutality led the Gods to cast him into the Ginnungagap Gulf from whence life had sprouted.
Using his blood, the Gods drowned the Giants and created the oceans, from his body they made Midgard the land of men.

Includes:
1 Titan Miniature 
1 Alternative Miniature Head
1 Titan Dashboard
8 3D Frozen Tokens
5 Activation Cards
1 Recruitment Card

Name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Dionysus
Description:
New 2018 expansion for Mythic Battles Pantheon

With Dionysus, we didn't want to create a combat-oriented unit, but rather a control oriented unit that represented opulence and chaos.

Let's start by looking at the power "Orgiastic Procession" which aims to simulate the arrival of Dionysus, accompanied by one of his procession. This power gives the player several troops who, themselves, have many activation cards. The goal is to support the notion of opulence, which is emphasized by the number of "art of war" cards that brings Dionysus, as well as a high number of life points.

The satyr children also help Dionysus controlling the map because they all possess the block talent. However, we don’t imagine that it is by physical might they manage to block off their enemies; it is because the units in their areas are too busy drinking their wine and feasting.

The power of the satyr children makes it clear that Dionysus is not here to kill the opponents by fighting, but on the contrary, for them to lose themselves in the chaotic bliss of merriment. This power greatly disrupts an opponent's position and, in effect, offers significant control on the map to Dionysus.

If the satyr children can neither attack nor collect gems, we imagine it is because they are busy serving wine to all the units in their area. This is represented by their block talent, as we have seen above, but also by the Bolster talent of the troops and the intoxicating power of Dionysus. This power, meanwhile, can generate chaos in the opponent's cards by forcing him to discard cards from his deck.

Clearly, Dionysus can be a technical unit to play, due to his low mobility which requires careful placement on the map. Despite this, he is ubiquitous on the field and has the capability to disrupt the opponent's strategy. This, combined with the fact that he can send satyr children to bring him Omphalos (simulated by the talent gem collector), allows one to achieve victory by attaining Omphalos.

—description from the publisher

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Playable Marvel 3D Trading Cards
Description:
These cards are only available from the Marvel 3D Trading Cards Packs sold in 2015.
They don't make them anymore.
The packs came with 5 cards, 3 3D non-playable cards of Legendary characters and 2 random playable cards. So the buyer had a random chance of getting 2 of the 95 playable cards. There was also a rare chance of a sketch card.
So after buying lots of packs, one might have enough to have a whole set of a hero, henchman or bystander set.
These trading card packs are the only way to get 3 alternate art 14-card Hero decks from the base game (Black Widow, Deadpool, and Hulk), 2 14-card exclusive Heros sets (Howard the Duck and Man-Thing), 2 10-card Henchmen decks (Circus of Crime, Spider-Slayer), and 1 5-card Bystander deck (Bulldoze Driver, Double Agent of Shield, Fortune Teller, Photographer, Stan Lee).

The complete set includes:

Black Widow Deck (14 cards, Alternate-Art, Hero) = 1 Rare Silent Sniper, 3 Uncommon Covert Operation, 5 Common Dangerous Rescue, 5 Common Mission Accomplished
Deadpool Deck (14 cards, Alternate-Art, Hero) = 1 Rare Random Acts of Unkindness, 3 Uncommon Hey, Can I get a Do-over, 5 Common Oddball, 5 Common Here Hold This For a Minute
Hulk Deck (14 cards, Alternate-Art, Hero) = 1 Rare Hulk Smash, 3 Uncommon Crazed Rampage, 5 Common Unstoppable Hulk, 5 Common Growing Anger

Howard the Duck Deck (14 cards, Hero) = 1 Rare Interplanetary Visitor, 3 Uncommon Right Place, Wrong Time, 5 Common Traveling Companion, 5 Common Rebel Without a Cause
Man-Thing Deck (14 cards, Hero) = 1 Rare Eternity of Solitude, 3 Uncommon Travel the Nexus of Realities, 5 Common Burn the Fearful, 5 Common Form the Ooze

Circus of Crime (10 cards, Henchman)
Spider-slayer (10 cards, Henchman)

Rare Bulldozer Driver (1 card, Bystander)
Rare Double Agent of Shield (1 card, Bystander)
Rare Fortune Teller (1 card, Bystander)
Rare Photographer (1 card, Bystander)
Uncommon Stan Lee (1 card, Bystander)

Name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Bearfoot 'Tessa Promo Card
Description:
Upgrade: Send one of your active dice to your reserve.

At the start of the Brawl phase you may choose to remove 1 die from your Battleground or Barracks to gain 1 Food.

The card is numbered UP-08.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).

Name: Ramodis
Description:
Sun has set and the farm is immersed in silence and tranquility... 
Everyone is waiting in the farm: guard dogs, flock of sheep and hunter wolves... Everyone is waiting for another night party!

Ramodis is a Persian reimplementation of "Nobody but Us Chickens!". A funny card game based on bluffing, mind reading and gathering the most sheep at the end of the game!

All players hold the same cards consist of sheep, wolves and a dog! Each round players choose a card from their hand which simultaneously they reveal. If all sheep, nothing happens. If some play a wolf they gather all the sheep, and if some play wolf while some play dog, the wolves discarded and the dogs gather all the sheep. At the end of 9 round players count their sheep and score them.

Name: Fahrt durch Venedig
Description: The players start from different spaces to reach the Piazza di San Marco (space 80). Movement is determined by two dice. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the players. From space 78 (Quai) on, the players roll only one die. The first player to reach space 80 wins the game.

Name: Der Fuchs im Hühnerstall
Description:
The fox-player has two foxes on the red spaces under the roof of the henhouse. The other player has 15 chicken, one on each of the board's green spaces. The goal for the chicken-player is to occupy all nine red spaces with one of his chicken. The goal for the fox-player is to reduce the chicken to eight pieces, thereby preventing occupation of the red spaces under the roof.
All pieces may move along all lines in any direction. The chicken may not jump or capture any pieces. The Fox may capture (remove from the board) a chicken by jumping over it to a vacant opposite space.

The Game box is marked with the Letters A H E and was printed by Litho-Druck Kappler, Ravensburg

—user summary

Name: Belfort: Edición Limitada
Description:
This includes both the base game and Belfort: The Expansion Expansion and Belfort: Guild Promo Pack #1.

The Belfort: The Expansion Expansion includes the assistants and some new guilds.The promo pack includes the Contractors' Guild,  Rules Lawyers' Guild, and Sentries' Guild.

Name: Monster Empire
Description:
The wise will know the way to the truth.

Monster Empire is a game about being the first to collect six types of jewels to become the King of Gandor. The players are all adventurers, who will fight against monsters to collect their treasures. In order to get as much treasure as possible, it's better to be few, but to be few, the player who knows the right location will need to fool the others into going the wrong way. Only the adventurers who can see through these lies will be the ones to first gather the gems!

Name: Wasgo
Description:
Journey to the islands of the Haida people to hunt animals of the land and sea in this unique trick-taking game. Play your cards wisely; you never know when the mythical Wasgo might turn your cards upside down!

In this trick-taking game, players compete to collect land and sea animal symbols. Each round, players will bid on a land animal type and receive one point per animal of that type collected in their score pile. Additionally, players will score their most valuable fish using multipliers that will continue to increase over the length of the game as players trigger them to upgrade by performing special actions. Wild cards (Eagle, Raven, Owl, and Wasgo) can be played for face value, or alternatively played along with other cards for their special abilities. Player should use their wild cards strategically, especially the Wasgo, which will flip the cards of all players upside down.

After 5 rounds, the player with the most points is named the best hunter in the land!

-description from designer

Name: Farlight: Mission Critical
Description:
Farlight: Mission Critical offers five daring new missions for Farlight that feature a unique countdown die mechanic. If you can succeed the benefits will be substantial, but if you fail the mission or can't complete it by the time the die expires, the losses to your ship and resources could be devastating!

Critical Missions are like no other mission you've undertaken before.

1. When a Critical Mission is revealed, roll a die and place it on the mission. This is now the countdown die. Reduce the die by 1 pip after every round.

2. Place bets to attempt to complete the Critical Mission as you normally would. When attempting to complete a Critical Mission you must roll another die, and add the value of your bets to the die roll. The result must be higher than the countdown die for the mission to succeed. If you are unable to complete the mission, the text below “Attempt Fail” is triggered.

3. If a countdown die reaches zero, the text below “Countdown Fail” is triggered.

-description from publisher

Name: LunaTix: Star Trackers
Description:
STORY
While players are travelling around planet Earth, they need to collect enough stellar navigation knowledge (Ticket points called ‘Tix’) to face a trip to the Moon (Luna). Tix can be earned by travelling to different continents, using different vehicles and by observing the Moon, the planets (expansion) and the constellations of stars. In the endgame the Tix are essential to overcome the obstacles to the Moon. The first player reaching the Moon with sufficient Tix covering those difficulties during the trip wins the game. When playing solo, a time restriction is added to win the game depending on the difficulty level.

OVERVIEW MECHANICS
The game board shows in the top left corner that each round, called a month, consists of three phases:

     Ecliptic phase: when the new first player shifts the Sun on the star map, lays out new observation cards in the observation area and initiates the first choice of the planning phase.
     Planning phase: each player in counter clockwise order, starting with the first player, chooses a vacant lunar phase (1 of the 4 weeks in a month) to plan an action by placing his meeple accordingly.
     Activation phase: Beginning with the first week (new moon), the planned actions are being executed. In a game with more than 4 players the direct observation takes precedent of travelling, then saving an observation card, ending with observing a saved observation card.


The star map shows the Sun with new background stars, forming a zodiac constellation, each month of the year. A day light card will cover the constellations present during the day. This dynamic alters the visibility in horizontal fashion, according what astronomers call Right Ascension (RA). The sunset and sunrise drawn on the daylight card forms the observer’s western and eastern horizon.
A map of planet Earth shows the continents you can travel to and can result in a visibility change as an observer according to the latitude change after each movement. The latitude correlates with the highest passing of the stars overhead; called zenith. The visibility in vertical fashion is expressed in what astronomers call Declination (DEC).  Blocks underneath an armillary sphere will indicate your northern and southern horizon.
The observation area contains a freshly laid out combination of observation cards that can be scored when visible according to the time of the year and the place the player is on Earth. The lunar phases are scored according to the right week of the month that they appear in.
The end game unfolds once a player reaches the launch pad for a voyage to the Moon. Once launched the player must tackle certain difficulties (Diff) by keeping the Diff values under their acquired knowledge and observation points (Tix). Special abilities, hidden agendas and lunar phase abilities can mitigate the values to be absorbed by your knowledge as a navigator.
The game invokes an elegant choice between efficient observation, puzzling travel routes, playing out opportunities with abilities and some courage to risk a rocket launch as soon as possible.

WHAT'S UNIQUE?
LunaTix: Star Trackers offers a highly educational chance to get in touch with a real star map and to learn its link with our location on Earth. The knowledge of our planet’s position and movement around the Sun, forming our seasons in time and climate regions in latitude, will provide you with a deeper insight on how people came to divide time and space as we know it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Great War at Sea: Jutland 1919
Description:
Imperial Germany laid down her last dreadnought in January 1915, and never completed her. But planning continued for new classes of battleships, battle cruisers, armored cruisers and scout cruisers. All understood that they could not possibly be built during the course of the ongoing First World War, but would be laid down afterwards.

Reflecting the lessons first of the battles of the Falklands, Coronel and Helgoland Bight, and eventually those of Jutland, the new German designs continued to emphasize protection. At the urging of sea officers, the new ships also now carried armament equal to that of the British, and would make much higher speeds as well.

Across the North Sea, the British Admiralty had no clear idea of what the Germans might be planning to build, but could state with certainty that they and other potential enemies would continue to improve their warships. New British dreadnoughts would carry ever-more-powerful armaments, including a new, secret 18-inch gun.

Jutland 1919 is a supplement for our Great War at Sea: Jutland game, studying these drawing-board battleships that would never actually be launched. It includes background essays, forty new scenarios, and 80 new silky-smooth die-cut playing pieces (60 double-sized "long" ship pieces and 20 square ones). It is not playable by itself; you’ll need our Jutland game and High Seas Fleet book to play the scenarios. You can, of course, just read the essays and fondle the pieces without owning either. We won’t tell.

New pieces include three classes of German battleships designed but never built: a fast battleship with eight 15-inch guns, a battleship with ten 15-inch guns in five turrets, with three of them in a unique triple-stacked arrangement. And an even larger ship with 16.5-inch guns. There are two new classes of battle cruiser, one with 15-inch guns, one with 16.5-inch guns. And two variations on the fast armored cruiser proposed after the Battle of Jutland, one with ten 8.2-inch guns, and one with twenty (20) 5.9-inch guns. Plus there are additional scout cruisers and destroyers.

The British for their part receive their improved but slower Queen Elizabeth class, with ten 15-inch guns, and the massive ships proposed to carry eight 18-inch guns apiece, based on the Hood design but slower with battleship-scale protection. Plus their own fast armored cruiser.

These are powerful new ships, and now you can lead them into battle.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Second Great War at Sea: The Cruel Sea
Description:
Our Second Great War alternative history story arc posits a world in which Woodrow Wilson’s attempts to forge a compromise peace in late 1916 succeeded. Millions of lives were saved and vast destruction averted, while the great empires of Eastern Europe – Germany, Austria, Russia and Turkey – survived for another generation. But not all accepted this new world order, and in August 1940 war returned to Europe.

The Cruel Sea is a truly massive expansion set for Second Great War at Sea. It features the ships, airships, helicopters and airplanes of Imperial Germany, Republican France and Imperial Russia.

There are 740 brand-new die-cut (and silky-smooth) pieces: 380 double-sized "long" pieces and 360 square ones.

The Cruel Sea is intended as the foundation of the Second Great War at Sea; other supplements, like Sword of the Sea, will draw on this set for playing pieces (which lets us put even more new toys in those sets rather than repeating the same pieces).

There are also thirty new scenarios based on the battles waged during the first eight months of this war that never happened, in our popular story-arc format. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Bismarck and Arctic Convoy to enjoy all of the scenarios.

Our Second Great War background book describes the alternative history behind these scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Armata Romana: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
Description:
At the moment German troops launched their surprise invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941, Romanian dictator Ion Antonescu declared a “holy war” against the Communist regime. A half-million Romanian soldiers participated in these early campaigns, fighting fierce battles in Bessarabia, at Odessa and in the Crimea.

Armata Romana is an expansion for our Panzer Grenadier: Fire in the Steppe game, featuring 98 die-cut, mounted pieces displaying the Royal Romanian Army – the Armata Romana – in its own special color scheme. There are also 20 scenarios, and three “battle games” that link them together.

Armata Romana is not a complete game; everything you need to play all 20 scenarios (and the battle games) in included in the book and the boxed game Fire in the Steppe. No other books or games are required to play any of the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Colorado: Sfida la Luna Nera!
Description:
Board game based on the Italian TV program "Colorado", which was broadcast by Rai in 1997-1998. The program featured a push-your-luck game in which the contestants selected a number of cards from a set. The more cards they selected, the more they earned, but also the more the chances that they'd find the card called La Luna Nera ("the black moon") and get no rewards.

The board game is a hybrid between trivia game and card draw. The players must advance their pawn on a track, and the first player to reach the end wins the game. In the first phase, the players must answer riddles to advance on the track. In the second phase, players try to guess the position of the Black Moon card from a set of face down cards, and they advance based on how well they do. In the third phase, the players draw cards from a different set and advance based on the value of the cards they draw.

Name: Spy Code: Safe Breaker
Description:
Mission #2: Safe Breaker | Crack the Code

Your mission is to break into the safe. Use your spy skills to scan, solve and crack the code. Safe Breaker is a game that combines skills, memory, and a little bit of luck. Collect the most treasures to win!

To start the mission, players pick a card and turn the safe combination to the corresponding number shown. Next, listen to the secret hint using your Spy Stethoscope as you gently press the fingerprint scanner to test the number. If the light is green, the safe will release some coins. If the light is red, you will get a clue. The spy who collects the five golden coins or two diamond coins first, wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Logic and Reasoning: Riddle Master
Description:
A children's game that has players moving along a board and tasks them with solving riddles.  It is intended as an educational game for young readers and it includes instructions for the teacher as well as an answer key.

Description from the box:

Brave the Riddle Master's reading challenge!  As players move through the maze, they are faced with the Riddle Master's logic and reasoning questions.  If they answer correctly, they could be the first to reach the heart of the maze!

Name: Silk Roads
Description:
Central Asia circa 160 CE.

The Silk Roads were built for trade between Europe and China. The most trade grew where the longest roads crossed each other. The swiftest traders traveled by horse through plains and mountains to dominate the roads and collect the most wealth.

Work together to build roads, but wealth is only collected on a long road by the player who put down the most sections. Silk Roads is an abstract tile placement game on an 8 x 8 game board. Players take turns to place sections of road (tiles) while following the topological restrictions imposed by the tiles already placed. The game is over when there are no more empty squares on the board or all players have passed. Each player then gains the wealth from the roads they dominate. The winner is the player who has gained the greatest wealth.

Dominate the expanding trade network of Silk Roads, while keeping a close eye on other players’ routes.

SILK ROADS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

-description from designer

Name: Unrecorded Siege
Description:
Unrecorded Siege is a single or co-operative strategy game set in the 15th Century, at the corner of the famous Hundred years war. Each player takes on the role of a General, controlling different types of units to win glory and the battle.

While playing in a 3*4 tiles battleground, players are acting as either French (Attacker) or English (Defender) generals, who will execute their military tactics with unique sets of armies, in assigning tactical formations for winning tactical positions, resources, siege weapons, and finally, the battle.

The game is conducted in 4 rounds with several phases in each round. In these phases, players will obtain their unique heroes, armies, and strategic cards. They will assign these heroes, along with the units in different locations for making an advantage in winning or cheating their opponent. After everything is set, players will alternatingly activate armies’ skills in making an influence in the battle. Through eliminating, suppressing, flicking, and deforming opponent’s formation, players will conclude the battle result by simply counting who has more units surviving and conquering these areas. After claiming resources (woods, rocks or alchemies mass) as a new landlord, players are granted the right to build tactical siege weapons (e.g. catapults, siege ram or watchtowers) on their lands for advanced tactical moves in the next round.

After fighting for 4 rounds, a final battle result will be out – either French conquering the English land, or the English successfully safeguarding their place.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Mecklenburg-Vorpommern
Description: Classic Monopoly in a Mecklenburg - Vorpommern edition.

Name: HashTagIt!: Family Edition
Description:
TheHystericalGameOfTaggingPhotos


The Party Game of tagging photos with outrageous Hashtags!

Play the best Hashtag caption from the cards in your hand. If yours is voted the Best, You win the Round!

Name: Il gioco dell'acqua
Description:
Free educational board game sponsored and distributed by the government of the Piedmont region (Italy). It is meant to teach children how to save water. It also teaches about local water sources.
The game comes in a canvas bag, and includes a board and 6 pawns. The players must add 2 six-sided dice.
The game is a simple roll-and-move. The players roll dice and advance on a single track. Spaces include information about water preservation and main sources of water in Piedmont.

Name: Red Menace
Description:
Over four years, 1951-1954, players take on the role of a community member in a typical American town. Your goal - ensure that in an age of ratting out, selling out and conspiracy that you emerge the least tainted, the least disgraced and the least shamed. The only effective way to do this, of course, is to ensure that the attention of the authorities remain firmly fixed on everyone else.

Game play is based on the card drafting mechanic and is straightforward. On your turn you select a card from a hand of cards and choose which player in your judgment would be the most damaged by that card. And then you play that card on that player and watch them rack up levels of social shame that would make anyone's grandmother blush. Of course, every other player is lining up to do the same to you, but hey, that's just business in a time of betrayal, me-first and "do it to Julia." Global Crisis cards are resolved each season that can dramatically change the "facts on the ground," as they absolutely did during this historical period.

While being historically-informed, this game isn't slavishly historical. The global crises, "ordering institutions" and other obstacles are all directly historical or are composites (like the characters).

Red Menace is a straightforward social game. Once you get the procedure down, the game play itself should take between 30 and 40 minutes. Don't dwell on what you're going to do - almost everything in the game brings social shame to your opponents, after all!

—description from the publisher

Name: High Roller
Description:
Combines the skill of a card game with the fun of a board game.
The object of the game is to win £100.000. Each player is dealt a hand of 7 cards from a standard set of playing cards.
A player may on his turn pick cards from a face down deck to improve your chances of a bigger payout, or roll the dice and land on spots where he can play runs of cards to gain bigger payouts from the bank. However wild card spaces may pay out or may hinder some or all the players

Name: Sorcerer: Raganhar Character Pack
Description:
Play as Raganhar and lead a pack of immortal Spirit Wolves that will devour your enemies!

You have the power to play Spirit Wolves directly from your grimoire. When a Spirit Wolf is destroyed, it may be replaced by a new one from your hand or shuffled back into your grimoire giving you omen tokens!

This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer containing a Raganhar avatar standee, the Raganhar character skill card, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Virgiliu Character Pack
Description:
Play as Virgiliu and use your pyromancy to burn your enemies to cinders!

You will rain fire damage upon opposing minions. If your fire sorceries destroy a minion, you will search your grimoire for more powerful sorceries or even an immortal phoenix to add to your hand!

This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer containing a Virgiliu avatar standee, the Virgiliu character skill card, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Children of Alyisia Lineage Pack
Description:
Play as The Shapeshifter and howl at the moon as you and your minions transform into savage beasts and tear your enemies apart!

As one of the Children of Alyisia, you will play form cards as Werewolf minions or as attachments, turning your other minions into werewolves! Your cards gain power the fuller the moon gets. You may also make ferocious attacks with your Avatar!

This pack is a complete Lineage Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Shapeshifter lineage skill card, a Moon Phase card, 2 moon markers, 6 damage counters, and 20 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Sylvanei Lineage Pack
Description:
Play as The Druid and ensnare your opponents with the ancient magicks of the forest.

As a descendant of the Sylvainei lineage, your minions will grow root armor while a never ending supply of Tree-Kin sprout forth to serve you. Over time, your Tree-Kin will grow into mighty Deeproot Guardians!

This pack is a complete Lineage Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Druid lineage skill card, 5 Tree-Kin/Deeproot Guardian token minions, a rules card, 8 root counters and 20 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Witch Mountain Domain Pack
Description:
Claim Witch Mountain as your domain and learn the secrets of the dead!

Your witches and their zombie puppets will grant you many omens, allowing you to reroll battle dice again and again.

This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Witch Mountain Domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Bloodsoaked Fjord Domain Pack
Description:
Claim the Bloodsoaked Fjord as your domain and crush your enemies with the mighty trolls of the north.

You will have no shortage of raw power with the trolls of the Bloodsoaked Fjord in your ranks. You’ll whip them into a berserker rage and unleash the mightiest of attacks.

This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Bloodsoaked Fjord Domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Royal Palace Domain Pack
Description:
With the Royal court as your domain, you are a master of neutral elemental sorcery. This offers you a good balance of deck searching, minion removal and control effects. Also, you will be able to summon the fallen Templars which fuel your sorcery mayhem.

This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Royal Palace Domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Jaleesa Character Pack
Description:
As Jaleesa you will command the powerful army of Anubians and Scarabians with impressive defense abilities. You will summon the Locust Pests of Seth, (god of chaos, war and change) which don't count toward the maximum number of minions on your side of battlefield!

This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer containing a Jaleesa avatar standee, the Jaleesa character skill card, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Lunatic Asylum Domain Pack
Description: This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Lunatic Asylum Domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Wachiwi Character Pack
Description: This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer containing a Wachiwi avatar standee, the Wachiwi character skill card, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Sorcerer: Thenoch Character Pack
Description: This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer containing a Thenoch avatar standee, the Thenoch character skill card, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

Name: Teflarok: Game of the Gods
Description:
Teflarok is a Norse themed card game using runes from the Elder Futhark alphabet and imagery of Norse gods and goddesses. It plays best with 3-9 players, but there is a 2 player variant included in the rules.

Each player gets three "Words of Power" cards that show a selection of runes. You need to collect these runes (on Rune cards) in order to complete the Word. Upon completing the Word, you get the indicated number of Power Tokens. Throughout the game, you use your Power Tokens to bid on the Rune cards.

The game centers around a unique silent bidding process that allows you to either get the Rune cards you need or gain more Power tokens. During a bidding phase, players will secretly take tokens into their hand then everyone reveals their bids all at once. The game end is triggered when someone has either completed all of their Words of Power, or have gained 500+ points in Power Tokens. After one last turn, Power Tokens are counted up, and the player with the most Power wins.

Nine unique player screens are used to hide your tokens. Each one features art work and a short bio of a Norse god or goddess (the different gods are cosmetic only; gameplay is not changed.)

—description from the publisher

Across the Bifrost bridge, the gods of Asgard await Ragnarok, the final battle, their inescapable fate. But what do the gods do in their downtime? Why, play Teflarok of course! It is the game of the gods after all. Now you get the chance to play as one of the gods. Collecting and casting magical runes that determine the fate of all mortals, best your friends in a game of strategy, vying for the most power.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Little Chinese Warriors
Description:
Unlike other boring educational game to learn chinese characters, little chinese warridor is very fun for family.

Through intense and exciting game competition, children can focus their attention and improve their cognition of Chinese characters, help them understand the correct composition of Chinese characters in game play, and gain an in-depth understanding of Chinese characters.:)

1. Shuffle all the cards and make them all face down on your table.

2. Youngest player first, initially clockwise. Each player take turns filp over one card.

3. When a player find two cards can form a Chinese character when he need to shout it out loudly the characters with correct pronouncation, and at the same time to cover these two cards with both hands, then he can take these two cards as scores of his.

4. If the pronouncation is not correct, need to discard a card which has been obtained, as a punishment.

5. When all cards been flipped over, or all players can not find characters they can compose, the game is over, players get the most cards wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Memory Game
Description:
Memory magic total have five series, Fruit, Journey to west, Ocean, Animals, Vehicles. Shuffle all chips backside face up evenly, then each player take turns to try to flip over two chips, if two images do not match, flip back and it's turn for next player. If they do match, you win the two chips . The player who gets most chips wins.

Each series has cute illustrations with english name for the child when doing memory training, parents can help them pick some favorite things such as animals, fruits, or vehicle, expand some common vocabulary pronuciation in English.

Let's enjoy Memory Magic!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Spelling Phonics
Description:
A natural spelling the full amount of the card game, somewhat small to carry, best for traveling time to consolidate what school of natural law of spelling it.

Cleverly integrated into 324 high-frequency words, 44 gold natural spelling rules, the use of basic play UNO won the hearts of children with humor cute style.

Course of the game will not dull, on the contrary full of joy.

Level 1, 2, 3 implemented progressively, step by step, let the children slowly into the lane in the game to fully grasp the natural spelling pronunciation rules.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Panda's Wish
Description:
It's a bit "sad" joke
On Panda's birthday, after blowing out all birthday candles, friends asked, What is your wish?
Panda says
I made two wishes
One is to have my dark circles cured
The other is shoot many colored photos
Then there is this game Panda's wish
We can not cure his black eye circles.
But we can help him shoot a lot of colored photos ...

1. After shuffle evenly, starting from the younger players, each player drawn 5 cards from the draw pile.

2. Flip over top card from draw pile, as starting card.

3. The next card must be the same color, or the same pattern match with previous card.

4. If the function cards is played, then you need to use the corresponding function.

5. When a player only two cards, you need to shout Panda so other players will notice.

6. Player who collects three star, win, and he is able to help to realize the Panda's wish.a

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Telling Time
Description:
Time is an abstract concept.
But it exist all time in our lives.
What time is it now?
Why we get up at dawn, and go to bed when get dard?
Why mom and dad only allowed me watch TV for only one hour a day?

Kids full of curiosity to this abstract friend - "time".
Telling Time, step by step, changllege different level of difficulty.
Let kids master more skills of time management during game play.

1. First, parent select one time card, put digital clock face up in the center of table.

2. Each player gets an animal analog clock.

3. Start from the youngest player, initially clockwise.

4. The player needs to put analog clock to the time show on digital time card.

5. The first player gets 3 coins, the player who get instructions from parents then finish, get 1 coin.

6. More and more advanced game play, wait you to challenge.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Shopping List: Mathematics
Description:
Shopping List is a image recognition, memory and match, pre-school mathmetic game for 3-6 year old kids.

Within a limited budget, let's do shopping, get to know the items in your shopping list, match and purchase, and get your changes back.

Who first get all items bought wins the game!

1. Each player gets a shopping list and a corresponding trolley.

2. Draw a price tag, and assemble it on your shopping list.

3. Each player will be dealt 30 USD as shopping fund.

4. Evenly shuffled 32 shopping item cards, place on center of table by 4 x 8 square.

5. Initially clockwise, each player take turns flip over one item card.

6. If the item is on your shopping list, pay the money, and put it into your trolley.

7. If the item card is not yours, flip it back, other player who need this item card, can remeber the position.

8. When player get all item cards on list, wins the game.

Name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Onyxia's Lair Raid Deck
Description:
Features the black dragon Onyxia.

Raid Decks represent struggles involving large numbers of players against epic foes. Raid Decks are specially designed pre-constructed products used for a cooperative experience. They combine elements from the World of Warcraft (the team-based questing), and Dungeons & Dragons (the Raid Master). One player, the Raid Master controls all monsters and foes, while 3-5 other players control the characters participating in the raid.

A Raid Deck typically contains epic boss cards, decks for the boss characters, tokens to represent minions, custom rules for the raid, and a treasure pack, intended as a reward for players who are victorious in the raid. The treasure pack contains holofoils and sometimes contains a random insertion of a loot card. Upper Deck Entertainment also made treasure packs available from their UDE points store, although the cards in these packs are not holofoil.

Name: Hot Corn
Description: Race to think of more words than your opponents! Place the deck of cards in the middle face down. The first player draws a card and spins the spinner. The player reads the category on the card corresponding to the number on the spinner, or chooses if a joker is spun. Flip the sand timer and each player privately writes all the words they can think of matching the category. For each word written that o other player wrote, earn one point. The winner is the player with the most points after 10 rounds. Alternatively, use the board and the move forward for each point. Lookout for spaces such as lose a turn or advance two spaces! The winner is the first player to reach the end.

Name: Olive et Tom Classico
Description:
- Select your players in the Junior League of Captain Tsubasa
- Choose your tactic.
- The match begins… Roll the dice and make the best action to beat the goal !

The game is based on the soccer anime Captain Tsubasa.

The game covers 3 matches, the first two are friendly matches. The last one is the Classico.

Before a match is the select phase.
You can make 2 actions between :
- Draw a new footballer (player card)
- Select a footballer by paying its value with your other cards.
The selected footballer goes on the field.

When the "Match" card is drawn form the deck, the match begins.

For a match, first you have to choose your tactic by positioning the footballers on the field.

Each footballer's card show arrows with numbers. The arrow represent occasions to pass the ball to the other players.

After that you roll 5 dice. The aim is to place a maximum of these dice on the arrows to show the direction of the ball between the footballers before the Goal.

The player who uses the most dice gain a point.

A friendly Match is done on 3 occasions, the Classico in 5.
The winner of the Classico also win the game.

Name: Star Realms: Ace of Aces
Description:
Released by the French publisher for the nomination of Star realms at 2017 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Expert.

Name: Ace of Aces
Faction: Trade Federation
Cost: 3
Primary Ability: Gain 2 Trade. You may place the next ship you buy during this turn on the top of your deck.

To use this card in your game, shuffle it into the Trade Deck during setup.

Name: Inis: Seasons of Inis
Description:
Inis welcomes a fifth player in the Seasons of Inis expansion! Discover new gameplay with the seasons wheel, bringing new modalities of victory! Explore the six new territories and lead your troops from the harbors to the island!

This expansion offers new action cards. Go back to the adventure, warrior, and may the gods be on your side!

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Stories: Tod in Hollywood Edition
Description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories with a Hollywood background which happened in real life.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

Name: Black Stories: Daily Disasters Edition
Description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories about stupid mishaps from real life.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

Name: The Drawing Game: The Hilarious Sketching Race
Description:
The Drawing Game is a new, fast-paced group boardgame. Your goal is to frantically draw your way to the bottom the Wordsmith’s wordlist faster than the other team to win each round, best of multiple rounds wins the game.

Split into two teams (more possible, but two is best) and one ‘Wordsmith’ and position each team in a different room in the house (living room and kitchen, say). The teams can be almost any size, so long as you can see the piece of paper being drawn on. The Wordsmith sits at an equal distance to the two teams (on the stairs, for example) with the Wordlist. At the beginning of the game, one member of each team comes to the Wordsmith, and 3, 2, 1... the Wordsmith whispers the first word on the list to the two team members.

The two team members sprint back to their teams’ as fast as they can, word in mind, pencil in hand, they start manically drawing the word on a piece of paper and whoever is first to guess the word correctly then, themselves, sprints to the Wordsmith to whisper the just-guessed word to them, hear the next word on the list, and sprint back themselves.

It is a speed drawing battle, and sprinting battle between the two teams to see which can get through the Wordsmith’s list of 20 words fastest. When one team wins, the Wordsmith shouts the winning team name. The game then continues for as many rounds as you wish to play - warning, it’s highly addictive so be careful.

The Wordsmith’s job is far from mundane and simple word whispering. They are a key element in the overall absurdity of the game. They are the only player that knows (kind of) what’s going on at any one time. The teams will be so engrossed in what they’re drawing and guessing at speed that it is the job of the Wordsmith to keep the teams in the know on who is in the lead, by how many, how many more words there are to the end of the round. They are also the main judge of cheating, they must keep a keen ear on proceedings for any whispering of words to teammates. If two teams come running out of their respective rooms at the same time, it is the Wordsmith who decides who really was in front. Some useful phrases to have in the back of your mind, imagine we have Team Fantastics and Team Golden Oldies:

“Fantastics and the Golden Oldies are neck and neck!”
“Oooh, I’m sorry to say Golden Oldies you’re three behind the Fantastics at this moment.”
“Golden Oldies have made a comeback and have just overtaken Fantastics!”
“Oh dear, what’s going on with Fantastics, you’ve been stuck on this one for a while now.”
“And there’s only three to go to the end of the game, come on Team Fantastic, you can claw this back!”
“Last word now, seconds to go in this round.”

—description from the designer

Name: Agra: Ambabari Elephant Promo Card
Description:
The Ambabari Elephant is an Agra promo card. The traditional Indian style of dressing these elephants was widely used to decorate the elephants of the Maharaj or the King. It was one of the most stylish and luxurious ways of travelling for the royal families.

Usage:
The Elephant is a level 3 notable, just put in the pile, shuffled before the game and randomly placed. Or you can decide to play with the Elephant anyhow.

Rules:
Immediately move the Merchant 1 to 6 steps of your choice. Every time the Merchant passes by one of your Workers you receive 1 Rupee. It doesn’t matter if your Worker has meditated or is still standing upright. You do not receive a Rupee for the space the Merchant ends or starts on, even if this space is occupied by your Worker.

Example: The Merchant moves 5 steps, of these 5 steps he passes through 3 of your own workers. You will receive 3 Rupees.

Name: Gingerbread Game
Description: On your turn, you pull the lever of the Gingerbread House to see which piece comes out.  If the piece that comes out is one you need for your Gingerbread Man, you put it on.  Otherwise, you get nothing.  The first person to complete their Gingerbread Man wins.

Name: Roll Player: Fiends & Familiars
Description:
In Roll Player: Fiends & Familiars, players can add more depth to their hero by adding a familiar to their character. These creatures add more options during character creation and help each player explore the mechanics of the game in new and different ways.

Fiends distract the players and provide new obstacles along the path of creation.

A brand new set of Monsters give the players variety to the end of the game, while new Minions are added to the Minion deck that provide new and different goals for the players to reach.

New classes and Market cards provide even more variety to each game of Roll Player.

Again, players earn Reputation Stars by constructing the perfect character, but can explore new strategies and options as they ready their familiar while they sidestep the pesky fiends along the way.

Requires Roll Player to play.

-description from designer

Name: Sandwich Masters: Order Up!
Description:
Order Up! is an expansion pack for Sandwich Masters.

Includes 4 new order cards, two new events, plus 4 blank order cards so you can design your own sandwiches!

Name: Naves en Combate
Description:
Challenge a friend to a battle. Take the reference monitor and build a fleet of ships to attack your opponent. Activate your ships and position them strategically on the map. Give your best attack using the Reinforcement Cards, but try ... not to lose any Mother Ship.

"Naves en Combate" (Ships in Combat) is a strategy and chance game for two players. Each one will be in charge of a fleet of ships with different attributes that will fight a battle on space platforms with obstacles and bonuses.
Players will get help from the battle environment and the Reinforcement Cards that will be used for their benefit or to deploy new ships in play.
The combat will not be simple since the motherships, sources of the Action Points, must be protected, an essential resource to start up the fleet of ships.
The winning player will be the one who destroys all the enemy motherships or who adds more energy points at the end of the game.

---

Desafía a un amigo a una batalla. Toma el monitor de referencias y arma una flota de naves para atacar a tu oponente. Activa tus naves y posiciónalas estratégicamente en el mapa. Da tu mejor ataque utilizando las Cartas de refuerzos, pero procura... no perder ninguna Nave nodriza.

“Naves en Combate” es un juego de estrategia y azar para dos jugadores. Cada uno estará al mando de una flota de naves con distintos atributos que librará un combate sobre plataformas espaciales con obstáculos y bonificaciones.
Los jugadores obtendrán ayuda del entorno de batalla y de las Cartas de Refuerzos que serán utilizadas para su beneficio o para desplegar nuevas naves en juego.
El combate no será sencillo ya que  deberán ser protegidas las naves nodrizas, fuentes de los  Puntos de Acción, recurso esencial para poner en marcha la flota de naves.
El jugador vencedor será aquel quién destruya todas las naves nodrizas enemigas o quién sume más puntos de energía al final de la partida.

Name: Lord of the Sea
Description:
A 38-page collection of fast play rules covering individual ship actions, major battles and featuring an extended campaign system, “Lord of the Sea” is centered set primarily on naval actions in Northern European waters in the 13th to 15th centuries. The rules have been written with 1/1200 scale models in mind, their inspiration being the models designed by Outpost Wargaming Services and others.

The rules mainly use six sided dice (d6), with ten sided dice (d10) used in some circumstances. Unless specifically stated otherwise all die rolls use a d6. Sometimes a d3 roll is called for. In this case roll a d6 and halve the score, rounding up (so a 1 or 2 gives  a result of 1, a 3 or 4 gives a result of 2, a 5 or 6 gives a result of 3).

You will need (in addition to models and a playing area) a handful of dice, a ruler measuring in inches, pens and paper. Ship damage states are denoted by markers. Suggestions for more visually attractive markers are given later in the rules. Also included at the end of the rules are sailing templates for caravels and other sailing ships.

-description from Wargame Vault

Name: Sheep Dog
Description:
The big bad wolf is very hungry! He tries to sneak into the farm to get something to eat. However the sheepdog, the guard of the farm, always keeps his eyes on the big bad wolf to protect lambs in the farm. Then, on a dark night, everyone in the farm falls asleep. The big bad wolf is very very hungry; he just breaks into the farm to have a big meal!

In Sheep Dog, the responsibility of the sheepdog is to protect these lambs and help them escape from the farm. On the other hand, he also has to catch this big bad wolf!! Who is the winner? Let's play!

Name: Build-A-Word Phonics
Description: Two players take turns dropping letter chips into a grid to form words horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Longer words are worth more points. The goal is to have the higher score once the grid is full.

Name: Congkak
Description:
Congkak (also known as Sungka and Chongka among others), is a multi-lap sowing game likely derived from Mancala in the 15th century.

Most Congkak or Sungka boards have seven pits on each of two sides, with a storehouse on each end of the board for each player.  However, some boards have more or less pits.  Each side of the board belongs to one player.  Boards are usually made of wood and carved into different designs.  The seeds are cowrie shells, though other items can be used.

The game is played similar to Mancala with some notable differences.  The goal of the game is to obtain the most seeds. The game starts off with seven seeds in each pit. Players get seeds by placing seeds into their storehouse.  Players take the first turn simultaneously.  During a player's turn, a player picks up pieces on their side of the board and drops a seed in each pit clockwise, placing a seed in their storehouse, but skipping the opponent's storehouse.  If a player drops the final seed in a pit with seeds, the player picks up the seeds in the pit and continues their turn, distributing the picked up seeds in another lap.  If a player drops the final seed in an empty pit on their side of the board, they capture all the seeds in the corresponding pit on the opponent's side of the board (as well as the seed they placed in an empty pit).  A player's turn ends when a seed lands in an empty pit regardless of which side it lands.  Play proceeds until all the seeds on one side of the board are empty.  If there are still seeds on a side of the board, the player who owns the side gets all those sides.

Games can also be played in rounds.  At the end of a round, each player fills up each pit on their side with the seeds they had in their storehouse; each pit gets seven seeds as in setup.  Leftover seeds remain in their storehouse.  If there are not enough seeds to fill a pit, the pit gets burned and removed from play.  Players cannot put seeds into the burned pit.  The series of rounds can be finished when a player can no longer sufficiently fill one pit with seven seeds.

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Ant-Man
Description:
Welcome to a world of microscopic science and adventure...welcome to the Microverse! Ant-Man and Wasp are world-renowned adventurers — two of the original founding Avengers. Together, they have fought for justice in the Avengers' greatest victories...and their most terrifying defeats.

Hank Pym, the original Ant-Man, has always had a giant ego to match his genius intellect. In a fit of hubris, he created the powerful robotic intelligence Ultron, which eventually built massive legions of robotic soldiers, threatening the world repeatedly and upgrading into a stronger form each time.
